items.content_html:
Automatic update generated by nixpkgs-update tools. This update was made based on information from https://github.com/viaduct-ai/kustomize-sops/releases.

meta.description for kustomize-sops is: A Flexible Kustomize Plugin for SOPS Encrypted Resource

meta.homepage for kustomize-sops is: https://github.com/viaduct-ai/kustomize-sops

Updates performed
  • Golang update
To inspect upstream changes

  • Release on GitHub

  • Compare changes on GitHub

Impact
Checks done (click to expand)
  • built on NixOS
  • The tests defined in passthru.tests, if any, passed
  • found 4.2.1 with grep in /nix/store/215dwvmcjrykn50m4sgfl9xdp0nl41zm-kustomize-sops-4.2.1
  • found 4.2.1 in filename of file in /nix/store/215dwvmcjrykn50m4sgfl9xdp0nl41zm-kustomize-sops-4.2.1
Rebuild report (if merged into master) (click to expand) 
1 total rebuild path(s)

1 package rebuild(s)

First fifty rebuilds by attrpath
kustomize-sops
Instructions to test this update (click to expand)

Either download from Cachix:

nix-store -r /nix/store/215dwvmcjrykn50m4sgfl9xdp0nl41zm-kustomize-sops-4.2.1 \
  --option binary-caches 'https://cache.nixos.org/ https://nix-community.cachix.org/' \
  --option trusted-public-keys '
  nix-community.cachix.org-1:mB9FSh9qf2dCimDSUo8Zy7bkq5CX+/rkCWyvRCYg3Fs=
  cache.nixos.org-1:6NCHdD59X431o0gWypbMrAURkbJ16ZPMQFGspcDShjY=
  '

(The Cachix cache is only trusted for this store-path realization.)
For the Cachix download to work, your user must be in the trusted-users list or you can use sudo since root is effectively trusted.

Or, build yourself:

nix-build -A kustomize-sops https://github.com/r-ryantm/nixpkgs/archive/c2a94a153736c832441ec39f4196322835ad6305.tar.gz

After you've downloaded or built it, look at the files and if there are any, run the binaries:

ls -la /nix/store/215dwvmcjrykn50m4sgfl9xdp0nl41zm-kustomize-sops-4.2.1
ls -la /nix/store/215dwvmcjrykn50m4sgfl9xdp0nl41zm-kustomize-sops-4.2.1/bin

Pre-merge build results

We have automatically built all packages that will get rebuilt due to
this change.

This gives evidence on whether the upgrade will break dependent packages.
Note sometimes packages show up as failed to build independent of the
change, simply because they are already broken on the target branch.

Result of nixpkgs-review run on x86_64-linux 1

1 package built:

Maintainer pings

cc @starcraft66 for testing.
items.title: kustomize-sops: 4.2.0 -> 4.2.1

items.content_html:
Description of changes

pre-commit-hook-ensure-sops is a Python package, as the name implies, for
testing sops-using repositories for
leaking secrets i.e., committing unencrypted secrets that should be
(automatically) encrypted by sops. It is primarily implemented for use as a
pre-commit hook but the command-line entrypoint is generally usable for
checking sops files for unencrypted secrets or invalid structure.

After addition to nixpkgs it can be more cleanly used by e.g.,
pre-commit-hooks.nix
(cachix/pre-commit-hooks.nix#212).

Things done
  • Built on platform(s)
    • x86_64-linux
    • aarch64-linux
    • x86_64-darwin
    • aarch64-darwin
  • For non-Linux: Is sandbox = true set in nix.conf? (See Nix manual)
  • Tested, as applicable:
    • NixOS test(s) (look inside nixos/tests)
    • and/or package tests
    • or, for functions and "core" functionality, tests in lib/tests or pkgs/test
    • made sure NixOS tests are linked to the relevant packages
  • Tested compilation of all packages that depend on this change using nix-shell -p nixpkgs-review --run "nixpkgs-review rev HEAD". Note: all changes have to be committed, also see nixpkgs-review usage
  • Tested basic functionality of all binary files (usually in ./result/bin/)
  • 23.05 Release Notes (or backporting 22.11 Release notes)
    • (Package updates) Added a release notes entry if the change is major or breaking
    • (Module updates) Added a release notes entry if the change is significant
    • (Module addition) Added a release notes entry if adding a new NixOS module
    • (Release notes changes) Ran nixos/doc/manual/md-to-db.sh to update generated release notes
  • Fits CONTRIBUTING.md.
items.title: Package python3Packages.pre-commit-hook-ensure-sops

items.content_html:
Description of changes

Addresses #175515

Renames exec plugin from ksops-exec to ksops like it was done upstream in v3.
Creates a symlink from ksops-exec to ksops for the sake of backwards compatibility.

/nix/store/5kkrsfvl5pp1cgk0mw1mp7smq1pr011c-kustomize-sops-3.0.2/
└── lib/
   └── viaduct.ai/
      └── v1/
         ├── ksops/
         │  └── ksops*
         └── ksops-exec/
            └── ksops-exec -> ../ksops/ksops*
Things done
  • Built on platform(s)
    • x86_64-linux
    • aarch64-linux
    • x86_64-darwin
    • aarch64-darwin
  • For non-Linux: Is sandbox = true set in nix.conf? (See Nix manual)
  • Tested, as applicable:
    • NixOS test(s) (look inside nixos/tests)
    • and/or package tests
    • or, for functions and "core" functionality, tests in lib/tests or pkgs/test
    • made sure NixOS tests are linked to the relevant packages
  • Tested compilation of all packages that depend on this change using nix-shell -p nixpkgs-review --run "nixpkgs-review rev HEAD". Note: all changes have to be committed, also see nixpkgs-review usage
  • Tested basic functionality of all binary files (usually in ./result/bin/)
  • 22.11 Release Notes (or backporting 21.11 Release notes)
    • (Package updates) Added a release notes entry if the change is major or breaking
    • (Module updates) Added a release notes entry if the change is significant
    • (Module addition) Added a release notes entry if adding a new NixOS module
    • (Release notes changes) Ran nixos/doc/manual/md-to-db.sh to update generated release notes
  • Fits CONTRIBUTING.md.
items.title: kustomize-sops: rename exec plugin to ksops
